Summary: IHG Platinum here, so I go out of my way to stay at their properties. I’d say this one is 5-stars, I really like the property and its location; however, no way does can it have 5 stars with add on fees. Call it whatever you want to call it (resort/parking fees), I stay at IHG properties because you can avoid the resort fees (especially when in Vegas). This property is literally surrounded by free parking hotels.  Don’t make the same mistake I did. The free parking Staybridge is only a mile away (and higher rated). I’d stay here again if I didn’t have a car (but who doesn’t have a car when traveling in this area??), but to ask IHG members to pay add on fees when we go out of our way to stay at IHG properties is kinda silly.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland but not walking distance
Summary: Stayed for 4 nights at this hotel. While this place is close to Disneyland, you need a shuttle or Uber to reach the park. The hotel is neat with large spacious rooms. There is no restaurant in the hotel but you have a fully equipped kitchen with microwave, stove, dishwasher and fridge. Staff is minimal and pool is not well maintained.  Breakfast is usual affair but they start picking up stuff as soon as the breakfast end time is reached (unlike other Holiday Inn properties). The Hotel has a convenience store located at the opposite gas station but no restaurants or eating joints around. Good place for a family stay.

Summary Heading: Card was charged twice so please check your billing
Summary: I had booked this hotel way back in October 2017 for our stay in June for an Advance payment deal. I’m Glad the stay was only for just one night.  Two weeks before the trip, I’d noticed that my credit card was being charged twice. Phone up the front desk from Singapore. The lady on the line was apologetic and told me that someone from the day shift would be able to check and call me back on my phone. No one did.  So, I wrote an email to the hotel reservation desk and received a reply two days, denying that they had charged me twice but the fees were held back. Obviously, the person replying to the email was not reading the emails or looking at the screenshot I had sent. The charges were made on two occasions within the same day and have already been reflected on my bills!

Great breakfast selection. Ample parking (although you do pay for it) and one nice girl at the front desk.   Cons: The pool is freezing! My kids didn’t last 5 minutes in its icy waters and it’s super small. One reason we stayed here was that breakfast was included, but it opened so late that we weren’t able to use this feature on Sunday. We did grab and go on Monday, which was nice. It’s a looooonnng 25 minute walk to Disney. Tired feet at the end of a long Disney day make this 25 minute walk seem like days instead. There is the ART bus or Uber, but next time I’ll make sure my hotel is within reasonable walking

Will recommend this to friends who are going to Anaheim in the near future for sure.

This particular property is difficult to locate unless you know exactly where it is since there is no signage near the street it is easy to drive pass.  Once we located the property, they would not allow us to check in at 1 PM and told us that we had to wait that check in was it 3 PM. We waited until  it was time to check in only to find out the rooms did not have keys that worked so we had to have maintenance allow us into our rooms until they can figure out the problems.   If we left her rooms, we had to bother them to allow us back in our rooms each time. They did offer compensation after we asked which was waving the $18 per day parking fee since they charge for parking on
Manager Response: Dear Steve L: Thank you so very much for your feedback on your recent stay with us. We apologize for any inconvenience we caused you and your party including locating our hotel. We do have a sign on each side of the building and we do have a monument sign that is currently being installed off of Ball Rd. We are truly sorry that our Room key software was performing an update during your check in. We are truly grateful that you allowed us to be the host hotel during your stay in Anaheim. In the future, we hope to have another opportunity to demonstrate our commitment in delivering you a first-class hospitality experience.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: Stayed twice at this hotel this summer. Both times were a great stay. We walked to Disneyland several times. 2000 steps to the back side of Downtown Disney and another 1000 to the gate. We faced the fireworks show and had a great view every night. Breakfast was good staff was super friendly. We'll be back!
Manager Response: Dear momof4inaz: We are thrilled to hear from another loyal repeat guest who had another enjoyable stay at the lovely Anaheim Staybridge Suites-At the Park. We love seeing that you enjoyed our clean and spacious suite. It is great hearing that our hotel's close proximity to Disneyland Resort and nearby restaurants was a good fit for your travel needs. We thank you for all of your kind comments about our Hotel staff. We look forward to you returning to the Staybridge Suites-Anaheim At the Park when your travel plans bring you back to the Disneyland Resort area. Sincerely, Dan Kramer General Manager

Summary: We enjoyed our stay very much... for the first several days. The staff was so friendly, breakfast was hot and constantly being replenished. Everything was clean and the pool, though small, was great. But on the last two days of our stay, housekeeping never showed up. The first time we thought it was because they were running late and we were in our room in the late afternoon, taking a break from the parks. We called the front desk when we got back, told them we were missed, and exchanged our used towels. The next day, housekeeping was literally cleaning the room next door as we left. Came back after a late park night - no housekeeping again! While it's not the end of the world, it was frustrating to have to deal with these errands after a long day, late night and having to leave
Manager Response: Dear Lisa B:  Thank you so very much for your feedback on your recent stay with us.  We are glad to see that our clean and spacious suite worked perfectly for your stay. We thank you for all of your kind comments about our complimentary breakfast and staff. Thank you for sharing your housekeeping observations. We are truly grateful that you allowed us to be the host hotel during your stay in Anaheim. We look forward to providing you with an amazing stay the next time you return to the Anaheim Staybridge Suites At the Park. Sincerely, Dan Kramer General Manager

Summary: Stayed at staybridge suites, apon check in one thing after another happened and the GM was the most unhelpful rude and inconsiderate man I have ever met in my life, this hotel should really rethink management or maybe send the manager for some more customer service skills training to stay working in the industry. When booking this hotel really think twice, their are a lot of hotels in the area and if you want something where the staff are going to treat you nice don't stay at staybridge suites Anaheim at the park.

Summary: The rooms were big and had everything - fridge, microwave, coffee maker, cutlery etc.  Big bathroom with quality TP and towels.  Decent breakfast if you like continental - the sausage patties were good but the eggs were from a package.  Housekeeping does the main clean up of towels, vacuum, garbage and arranging sheets daily.  but complete clean up is on request or per short stay. Good staff and enough parking at $18+ a day.  Lousy small pool that looked a bit dirty!! Overall if you are not wanting to swim, great room for a great price.
Manager Response: Dear dishanw: Thank you for sharing your feedback on your recent stay with us. We love seeing that you enjoyed our clean and spacious suite with the refrigerator and microwave. Summary: We just returned from a family Disney vacation. Since I am an IHG Spire member I booked reward nights and could not have been more satisfied. Quick caveat, the elevator can be slow.. Ok that it is out there, when I arrived I was greeted by Kevan and he could not have been more helpful. We got in a bit early and he gave us a great recommendation where we could hang out for a bit and we had fun. Our room was comfortable and had everything we needed. The breakfast was great, and there was new choices every morning. It can be a bit chaotic before the guests going to the park are there but they have lots of staff taking care of the area. Parking was easy.  I would stay there again, and recommend it for people that want to be near the park or I 5!
Manager Response: Dear Mikreyn: Thank you for sharing your feedback on your recent stay with us. We love seeing our Spire members and their families enjoy the magic of a Disney vacation. We thank you for all of your kind comments about Kevan and our Hotel staff. We look forward to you returning to the Anaheim Staybridge Suites At the Park when your travel plans bring you back to the Disneyland Resort area. Sincerely, Dan Kramer General Manager

Summary: Great hotel for family of 5 or less. Very good location to Disney Land and other areas.  Very nice hotel and people works there are very friendly. We enjoyed our stay there for 4 nights. The room is very clean. The pool is also clean. It's nice that they have  social time in the evening for gathering.

We look forward to you returning to the Anaheim Staybridge Suites At the Park when your travel plans bring you back to the Disneyland Resort/Anaheim area. Sincerely, Dan Kramer General Manager

Summary: We went to this hotel due to problems we had at the one we were staying at. Well we really enjoyed it. The studio has a good setup, its fresh, spacious. Breakfast is ok. Pretty much the same food everyday but ok. Evening snacks are good. My kids enjoyed the pool. Quiet hotel. Nice and friendly staff. Housekeeping didn't go to our room everyday but as soon as we would call they would send someone. Overall we enjoyed our 5 night stay. Also, we weren't there to go to Disneyland. I did see people walking but I personally think it's far to walk there and that's because I have stayed at a hotel that took no longer than 5 minutes to get there.

Summary: We had an overall good stay at this hotel. The rooms are nice and the hotel is new and modern. The free breakfast was pretty standard nothing special but good enough for us. We chose to uber to and from John Wayne airport which worked out very well. The walk to Disneyland was not too bad but could be long after 12 plus hours at the park. If you don't like to walk or don't like to for any reason get a rental car.

Summary: I thought that in booking a newer construction hotel, the place would be much nicer. Our bathroom was dirty with smears all over the door, a dirty looking shower floor, weird water stains on the bathroom floor, and the room had a very strange strawberry chemical smell to it (maybe from someone smoking a flavored vape in the room?). We could hear the people above us stomping around in the late evening and early morning, and the pool is a sad, small slab of fenced in concrete.  Not the nicest of hotels in the area, even despite being new. Staff was ok, albeit distracted. Would not stay here again.

Summary: This newer hotel is nice for a large family. I stayed in a 2 queen room with sofa pull out and it was spacious for 2 adults and 3 children. They had a good, free breakfast in the morning. There is a small pool with a firepit and overall a clean hotel. The few main negatives are they don't have a hotel shuttle, it is not a convenient to walk to the parks and the elevator takes awhile as there is only 1 for the whole building. There is a city bus near the hotel, but we ordered an Uber for $10 one way for 5 people. It was cheaper than the city bus and it dropped us right off. I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear alexngm: Thank you for sharing your feedback on your recent stay with us. We love seeing that you enjoyed our clean and spacious suite. The second one is located on the west side of the hotel. It goes from the Parking garage to all guest room floors as well. As for the shuttle, we do participate in Anaheim Resort Transportation (ART Shuttle) program. We have the ART shuttle tickets at the Front Desk. We are very grateful that you allowed us to be your host hotel during your visit to the Anaheim area. Sincerely, Dan Kramer  General Manager

Summary Heading: A great place for a weekend stay at Disneyland
Summary: We booked this hotel as a Priceline Express Deal and we were very pleased. Overall the hotel is great. It is new so all of the space is very clean. When we arrived we were greeted by two very nice desk clerks who checked us in and proceeded to let us know that the fireworks would be going off out front in 2 minutes if we would like to see them. We walked outside to the front parking lot and the fireworks started. It was perfect!   We then checked into our room which was a very spacious 2 queen with a full size sofa bed. The room was beautiful and faced the pool area so it was quiet outside. The rooms are designed for long term guests so they are equipped with a full sized refrigerator, stove top, dishwasher, etc. There is also a full sized coffee maker for those who like a lot
Manager Response: Dear samismac: Thank you for sharing your feedback on your recent stay with us. Summary Heading: A Beautiful Property and Great Team!
Summary: I recently has the pleasure of staying at this property for my wife's birthday.  I found the facilities to be very clean and the team to be very helpful and accommodating.  I had some flowers delivered to the hotel prior to my arrival and the team was happy to set them up in our room before we arrived.  The team also upgraded our room for my wife's special day.  I have had some poor experiences in the past traveling on an employee rate.  Some hotels can treat you as "less than" because you are receiving an employee discount.  That was not the case at all here.  Gary and Liliana at the Front Desk were awesome.  They answered all our questions with a smile. Summary Heading: Beautiful New Hotel Walking Distance to Park
Summary: New hotel right next to Disneyland Park. Beautiful rooms, friendly and knowledgeable staff, walking distance to tons of great restaurants and the park, great breakfast, gorgeous lobby, meeting rooms, and a gym. This hotel is ideal for a family trip. My wife and I highly recommend this property over others in the Anaheim area, and we have stayed in plenty of them! Be sure to ask for a "fireworks view" room and check out the fire pit lounge area by the pool.

I would highly recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Walking Distance to Disneyland and Affordable
Summary: The hotel is located at a great location. Only 15 minutes walk to Disneyland. The rooms are all suites, kitchen, full size fridge, plates, silverware, etc are provided. They have complimentary breakfast which was great. The rooms were very spacious and clean. Would recommend, very affordable and if you want to cut cost of eating out. This is the place for you. You can bring food and cook. The room does not have an oven, but has a microwave and one electric burner built in hot stove. Enough to cook meals. They have a parking garage you can park for a minimal fee per day. Like I said it walking distant to Disneyland, so you can leave you car parked there and walk. Which is faster and you can avoid the outgoing and incoming traffic to the Park.
